org.diachron.detection.utils

Class DatasetsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.diachron.detection.utils.DatasetsManager

  • public class DatasetsManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for the management of various dataset versions which refer on a specific dataset URI. Each dataset version is stored in the corresponding named graph within Virtuoso.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

        public DatasetsManager(java.util.Properties prop,
               java.lang.String datasetURI)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a new DatasetManager instance w.r.t. a properties file and a dataset URI. The properties file contains the credentials for Virtuoso.
        Parameters:
        prop - The properties file.
        datasetURI - The URI of the dataset which will be considered
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • deleteDatasetVersion

        public void deleteDatasetVersion(java.lang.String versionUri,
                        boolean deleteVersionContents,
                        boolean deleteAssocChangesOntologies)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes all the triples of the given named graph. Moreover, it deletes all the relations which contain the given named graph URI within the relations named graph.
        Parameters:
        versionUri - The version which will be deleted.
        deleteVersionContents - A flag which denotes where the version contents will be deleted as well.
        deleteAssocChangesOntologies - A flag which denotes whether the associated change ontologies will be deleted as well.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteDataset

        public void deleteDataset(boolean deleteVersionContents,
                 boolean deleteAssocChangesOntologies)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes a dataset from the Triplestore by deleting all its versions.
        Parameters:
        deleteVersionContents - A flag which denotes where the version contents will be deleted as well.
        deleteAssocChangesOntologies - A flag which denotes whether the associated change ontologies will be deleted as well.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • assignVersionToDataset

        public void assignVersionToDataset(java.lang.String versionGraph,
                          java.lang.String versionLabel)
        Associates a dataset version (i.e., named graph) and its optional label with a given dataset URI given as parameter. Note that the dataset version must be already imported within Virtuoso. All these dataset-versions relationships are stored within namedgraph http://datasets.
        Parameters:
        versionGraph - The named graph which contains the triples of the new version which will be attached.
        versionLabel - A human understandable label for the dataset version (can be null).

      • assignVersionsToDataset

        public void assignVersionsToDataset(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> versionUris)
                             throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                    java.sql.SQLException,
                                    java.io.IOException
        Associates a set of dataset versions (i.e., named graphs) and their optional labels stored into a Map with a given dataset URI given as parameter. Again, all the given dataset versions must be already imported within Virtuoso.
        Parameters:
        versionUris - A map which contains the named graphs (as keys) along with their corresponding values (as values)
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • fetchDatasetVersions

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fetchDatasetVersions()
        Returns a Map with all the versions of the given dataset URI (as keys) along with their corresponding labels (as values). The versions are returned sorted from the oldest to the newest. These relations are stored within named graph http://datasets.
        Returns:
        A map with the versions of the given dataset.

      • fetchDatasets

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fetchDatasets()
        Returns a Map with all the datasets URIs (as keys) along with their corresponding labels (as values). These datasets are stored within named graph http://datasets.
        Returns:
        A map with all the datasets which are examined by the change detection module.

      • fetchDatasetUri

        public java.lang.String fetchDatasetUri(java.lang.String datasetLabel)
        Returns the named graph URI of a specific dataset with label given as parameter.
        Parameters:
        datasetLabel - The label of the dataset.
        Returns:
        The dataset URI or null if there is no dataset found.

      • fetchVersionUri

        public java.lang.String fetchVersionUri(java.lang.String versionLabel)
        Returns the named graph URI of a specific version with label given as parameter.
        Parameters:
        versionLabel - The label of the dataset version.
        Returns:
        The version URI or null if there is no dataset found.

      • fetchDatasetLabel

        public java.lang.String fetchDatasetLabel(java.lang.String datasetUri)
        Returns the label of a specific dataset with URI as parameter.
        Parameters:
        datasetUri - The URI of the dataset.
        Returns:
        The dataset label or null if there is no dataset found or if the dataset has no label.

      • fetchDatasetRangeVersions

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fetchDatasetRangeVersions(java.lang.String start,
                                                                         java.lang.String end)
        Returns a Map with the versions of the given dataset URI (as keys) along with their corresponding labels (as values) ranging from version start to version end. The versions are returned sorted from the oldest to the newest. These relations are stored within named graph http://datasets.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting version
        end - The ending version
        Returns:
        A map with the versions of the given dataset and the given range.

      • fetchDatasetNextVersion

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fetchDatasetNextVersion(java.lang.String curVersion)
        Returns a Map with the next version (and optional label) of the given version and dataset URI.
        Parameters:
        curVersion - The current version
        Returns:

      • insertDatasetVersion

        public void insertDatasetVersion(java.lang.String versionFilename,
                        org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat format,
                        java.lang.String versionNamedgraph,
                        java.lang.String versionLabel,
                        java.lang.String datasetUri)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Imports a dataset version and an attached label, expressed in an RDF format (e.g., RDF/XML, N3 etc.), within a specific named graph within Virtuoso. Moreover, the method attaches the inserted dataset version to a specific dataset URI.
        Parameters:
        versionFilename - The file which contains the RDF data which will be inserted.
        format - The RDF format of the inserted data.
        versionNamedgraph - The namedgraph which will host the inserted data.
        versionLabel - A human understandable label which describes the inserted dataset version.
        datasetUri - The dataset which is correlated with the inserted dataset version.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • insertDataset

        public void insertDataset(java.lang.String datasetUri,
                 java.lang.String datasetLabel)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Attaches a human-understandable label upon a dataset URI
        Parameters:
        datasetUri - The dataset which will get the label.
        datasetLabel - A human understandable label which describes the inserted dataset.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
